description.narrative: Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The project will strengthen labor demand by targeted measures to improve the employability of workforce (particularly youths, women, low skilled) through engaging with private job brokerages (employment service providers) The project is part of a larger programme: World Bank Employment Support Development Policy Loan in the amount of $50 million. The project will be implemented by the World Bank using bank executed trust fund modality. The project is 23MSEK over three years, 100% supported by Sida.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Projektet kommer stärka efterfrågan på arbetskraft genom riktade åtgärder för att förbättra anställningsbarheten av arbetskraften, särskilt unga, kvinnor och lågutbildade, genom att samarbeta med privata arbetsförmedlare. Projektet är en del av det större programmet World Bank Employment Support Development Policy Loan värt $50 miljoner. Projektet kommer att implementeras av Världsbanken genom fonderade medel förmedlade av VB (Bank Executed Trust Funds). Projektet finansieras med 23 miljoner SEK under 3 år, 100 % finansierat av Sida.

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank
International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

tag.narrative: 8.5 - By 2030, achieve full and productive employment and decent work for all women and men, including for young people and persons with disabilities, and equal pay for work of equal value.

8.5 - Senast 2030 uppnå full och produktiv sysselsättning med anständiga arbetsvillkor för alla kvinnor och män, inklusive ungdomar och personer med funktionsnedsättning, samt lika lön för likvärdigt arbete.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Conclusion on Performance is made on basis of second annual report received from the World in July 2020. The target group of the intervention are the long term unemployed in the BiH laborforce, with particular focus on women and youth. An amendment (no cost) was made to include COVID 19 related job losses as well. The project partners with the public employment services with an impact objective of improving the outreach of their programs (wage subsidies mostly) that World Bank estimates reach less than 5% of registered jobseekers. The World Bank is managing the project in sequence of three steps. During the first year, a contract was awarded to Deloitte to make a diagnostic of selected companies (small and medium size private companies) in order to determine main obstacles and needs for increasing labor demand. This work was completed during year 1 of the project. During the 2nd and 3rd year, the World Bank will, through a contract awarded to Kolektiv doo, a private employment agency, pilot a package of services to jobseekers that will improve their ability to find and hold jobs (initially the idea was that the jobseekers will be taken from official lists) Kolektiv will be paid a fixed price per beneficiary placed in a job. The aim of the pilot is to encourage provision of an optimal set of personalized services in the most cost effective way. The beneficiaries will have the same characteristics as those served through the public system. The project will target 2500 through a public call (instead of pool of registered due to limitations with protection of personal data legislation) At least half will be women, low skilled and long term unemployed. Finally the World Bank at the end of the project will make an evaluation of the Kolektiv pilot which will support the overall development objective of the project which is to inform policy making on the impact of the private provision of employment services. Due to the COVID situation, the project had to adjust. A 12 month no cost extension (the WB did not ask for additional funds) was agreed in June, and the number of target beneficiaries expanded from 2000 to 2500. A call was published by Kolektiv doo in August covering two cantons (Sarajevo and HN Canton) For the time being, according to the WB, the call will be limited to those two cantons. It is assessed that there will be a huge demand from the call.The report also contains an updated risk analysis which is assessed to contain accurate risks. The report is also made on the financial situation. It is showing actual and commitments of 1,2MUSD cumulative against a revised budget of 2.69MUSD. This is in line with progress on activities. The controller has seen the financial statement and issued no comment.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
